text: Having found a lion and a bear at the same time at a deer's nest, they challenged themselves in battle to see which of the two would stay with the prey. A fox passing by, seeing them exhausted by the fight and with the deer in the middle, grabbed it and ran quietly through them. And the bear and the lion, exhausted, and having no strength to rise, murmured, saying, Woe unto us! So much effort and so much struggle we put in to keep everything for the bitch! By insisting we don't want to share, we can lose everything.
title: La zorra, el oso y el león
author: nan Esopo
